main event: A luminous circular object, approximately 30-40 feet in diameter and emitting a bright white light, was observed moving rapidly over the island of Kyushu, Japan on November 20, 1950.
interesting points: The object was observed for approximately 3-5 minutes before disappearing at an extremely high altitude.
The sighting was witnessed and reported by several people, including $T/SGT. Raymond A. Creveling.
The weather at the time of the sighting was clear with excellent visibility.
An investigation was initiated by the intelligence officer at Ashiya Air Base.
The report was submitted to the Commanding General of the Air Materiel Command at Wright-Patterson Air Force Base.
sighted object: a luminous circular object, approximately 30-40 feet in diameter, emitting a bright white light
witnesses: $T/SGT. Raymond A. Creveling and several other people
